bingo.error.command_blocks_disabled: Command blocks are disabled on this server. Please make sure the server.properties file does have all mentioned values set as described %s.
bingo.resourcepack_check.go_to_lobby.par: The resource pack was successfully enabled.
bingo.resourcepack_check.wrong_version.d:
You are using an incompatible version of the Fetchr resource pack.

Please download the correct version %s, enable it and click “re-check” down below.
bingo.resourcepack_check.wrong_version.s: If the resource pack was applied automatically through a server resource pack, please inform the server admin to update it.
bingo.setup.error.unknown_category: Item %1$s has category %2$s, but category %2$s could not be found.
bingo.game.menu.hint: Hint: You can click %s anywhere to bring up the Fetchr menu. You may also run %s manually, replacing %s with the auto-completable action.
bingo.game.menu.options:
%s to go back to the lobby.
%s to switch to spectator mode.
bingo.game.switch_gamemode.hint:
Hint: You can use the command %s at any time manually to switch to spectator mode as well.
If you do not like this functionality, you can disable it in your preferences in the lobby.
bingo.game.switch_gamemode.prevented:
Prevented game mode switch. %s for spectator mode.
Afterwards, you can switch to any other game mode.
bingo.preferences.title: Change Preferences
bingo.preferences.description: This menu allows you to configure your own preferences.
bingo.preferences.custom_hud.title: Configure Fetchr HUD
bingo.preferences.custom_hud.description: In this menu, you can move components of the custom HUD around, disable them, or adjust some component-specific settings.
bingo.preferences.spectator_mode.title: Prevent manual game mode switching
bingo.preferences.spectator_mode.descrip:
When on, you will not be able to use /gamemode commands, F3+N or F3+F4 to switch your game mode while in game.

This is done to prevent accidentally hitting those button combinations.

There is a chat message you can use for switching to spectator mode instead. After switching to spectator mode or getting all 25 items on the card, you can switch your game mode freely again.
bingo.preferences.custom_hud.add_disable: Here, you can view disabled components and add them somewhere to your HUD.
You currently have all components enabled.
Adds the component to the display slot.
Cannot add component to this slot, as there is no space left.
Here, you can switch positions of components, move them to a different column, or adjust component-specific settings.
There are no components which are currently in this display slot.
Moves component to the other display slot.
Switches position of this component with the above component.
Switches position of this component with the below component.
Removes the component from your HUD.
bingo.preferences.custom_hud.adjust_card: Here, you can change settings about the bingo card.
Moves the bingo card to the left side of the hotbar.

Moves the bingo card to the right side of the hotbar without leaving space for the attack indicator.
In case “Options → Video Settings → Attack Indicator” is set to “Hotbar”, please select the other option.
Move to Right of Hotbar (Attack Indicator)

Moves the bingo card to the right side of the hotbar while leaving space for the attack indicator.
Only use this option if “Options → Video Settings → Attack Indicator” is set to “Hotbar”.
bingo.preferences.custom_hud.component_s: Seed Settings
This page allows you to customize settings for the seed display
Only show seed after run completion

With this setting, the Fetchr seed will only be revealed after a completed run.

Specifically, this means after collecting all 25 items, or after returning to the lobby.

If you want to properly disguise your spawn location, you also need to either not use F3 or set Options -> Chat Settings -> Reduced Debug Info to ON.
Always show seed
With this setting, the Fetchr seed will always be shown.
Chunk Coordinate Settings
This page allows you to customize settings for the chunk coordinate display
Show instead of position when holding treasure map

This setting removes this component from the list and instead shows the chunk coordinates in place of the normal coordinates when you are holding a treasure map.

This is useful for finding the specific block of treasure, as it's always on chunk coordinates 9 9.

Use the settings of the normal coordinates to change this back.
Coordinate Settings
This page allows you to customize settings for the coordinate display
Show chunk coordinates when holding treasure map

With this setting, chunk coordinates are shown instead of regular coordinates when holding a treasure map.

This is useful for finding the specific block of treasure, as it's always on chunk coordinates 9 9.
Enable separate chunk coordinate component

With this, the coordinates are no longer replaced by chunk coordinates when holding a treasure map, and instead a separate component with chunk coordinates is inserted if there is space.

You can of course also disable that component like any other component.
Use Compass Icon
Changes the coordinate icon to a Minecraft compass item.
Use Text Icon
Changes the coordinate icon to a textual representation of cardinal directions.
bingo.lobby.credits.community_and_suppor: In this book, you find some useful links for support, bug reports and suggestions.
bingo.lobby.card_generation.from_seed.in: %s to receive the command for setting the seed. Add the numeric seed at the very end of the command.
bingo.lobby.card_generation.from_seed.ex: The seed determines which items generate on the bingo card and where you spawn. You can use this for example for competitive races, where everyone is using the same seed.
bingo.lobby.card_generation.start_game.a: You cannot start a new game without generating a new card.
bingo.lobby.card_generation.start_game.n: You cannot start a game without having generated a bingo Card.
bingo.lobby.settings.more_coming.change_: Do you want to change future settings?
Error accessing the future. Please talk to your local time machine operator.
Good decision. Who knows, maybe these settings are awful.
bingo.lobby.settings.pregen_behavior.inf: Terrain is pre-generated around spawn as soon as you hit the “Start Game” sign. This results in an additional wait time after starting the game.

Pre-generation will automatically start 5 seconds after generating a new card. This may cause lag in the lobby while it is happening, making some functionality in the lobby slow to react and unresponsive in some cases.
bingo.lobby.settings.strict_mode.info: This setting is intended for public servers. Using this setting, everyone in the lobby will be in adventure mode and game controls will be disabled for non-operators.
bingo.lobby.settings.strict_mode.revoke_: You can also revoke the OP status of a certain player using %s command. Replace <player_name> with the player you want to revoke the status from.
bingo.strict_mode.confirm_op: Please %s to confirm your operator status.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.chests.book.heading: Category Chests
bingo.lobby.tutorial.chests.book.page1:
The chests to the right display all the items that are in the Fetchr item pool.

Each column is a category. Only one item of each category can appear at the same time on any given card.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.chests.book.page2:
A column starting with an empty slot is a continuation of the category in the last column.

An item can also have multiple categories, which restricts it more, as the item can only be picked when none of the items in any of its categories are on the card.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.chests.book.page3:
Items can also have weights. The higher the weight is, the more likely it is for the game to pick the item from the category.

Use the sign above to re-generate the chests.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.goals.introduction:
In Fetchr, there are different kinds of goals to go for.

The following pages detail all the goals that are detected.

You do not need to select the goal, simply keep playing until you are done.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.goals.planning.head: Planning
bingo.lobby.tutorial.goals.planning:
It is recommended to plan before starting the game what to go for.

For planning the run, you can use the marking functionality on the card in the lobby. Simply use left or right click on the item frames.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.goals.bingo.heading: Bingo
bingo.lobby.tutorial.goals.bingo:
For a bingo, get all of the 5 items in any of the rows, columns or diagonals.

If you manage to get the 5 required items without any additional items, that is called a “Sniper bingo”.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.goals.blackout.head: Blackout
bingo.lobby.tutorial.goals.blackout:
A blackout is simply getting all of the 25 items.

Try to be as efficient as possible, getting items from similar sources together and smelt while you are doing other stuff in the area.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.goals.20_no_bingo:
Get 20 items without achieving any bingo.

When planning, try to think about which items to avoid in order to achieve this goal. Beware of items you might pick up accidentally, such as arrows when fighting skeletons.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.goals.multiple_bing:
For this goal, you need to get multiple bingos at once.

You do that by getting 4 items in intersecting rows, columns or diagonals and then get the item at the intersection last.
This includes double, triple and quadruple bingo.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.game_info.introduct: This book contains some general information about the game. There are some custom world generation changes, which are also detailed in here.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.game_info.general: All the items in the game require the exact variant as pictured. All items that look the same count (i.e. an enchanted book does not require any specific enchant, but a red bed requires the specific color).
bingo.lobby.tutorial.game_info.game_rule:
The weather is always sunny to prevent endermen from being annoying.

Phantoms, wandering traders and pillager patrols are disabled. All of these are based on a global timer, causing issues when playing multiple runs.
bingo.lobby.tutorial.game_info.world_gen: Fetchr uses some world generation customizations.
Biome sizes are decreased to enable easier exploration. Due to some limitations, you might notice other differences in the biome layout as well.
In order to make dungeons reasonable to find in a fast-paced Fetchr game, the rates of dungeons are increased by a factor of 12.5, making it easy to find them in any given run.

The cave frequency got slightly increased (from 1/7 in vanilla to 1/6).

Furthermore, ocean biomes do not generate any flooded caves in this map.
Mineshafts turned out to be too overpowered, giving easy access to lots of chests. Thus, they are disabled in Fetchr.

All stone variants like DiorITE, GranITE and AndesITE are completely removed from the generation in this version.
This is done to reduce inventory clutter.

There is a dimension setting in place that lets you see in the dark similarly to the vanilla nether.
This works without night vision while you are still able to tell darkness apart from light to some degree.
